item.title: Apple’s latest iPhones charge faster over a wire
item.description:
All the new iPhone 16 models unveiled this week can reportedly charge more than 50 percent faster through a wired USB-C connection than the previous series. That’s according to a Chinese certification posted on Weibo indicating that Apple’s latest iPhones can support up to 45W of wired fast charging.

The certification from the China Quality Certification Centre regulatory body, also posted to X by user ShrimpApplePro, shows all of the new iPhone 16 models were tested at 5-15 volts and 3 amps, which equates to a 45W maximum. The iPhone 15 lineup maxed out at 29W. As noted by 9To5Mac, it’s not unusual for Apple to neglect announcements around wired charging.

The 45W max of the iPhone 16 easily bests the Google Pixel 9’s 27W capabilities...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Jess Weatherbed

item.title: Amazon deal of the day: Snag a Samsung Galaxy Tab S9+ at a record-low price
item.description: The best Amazon deals on Sept. 10 include a Samsung Galaxy Tab S9+, Fire HD 10 Kids Pro, AirPods Max, Shark SmoothStyle, and Galaxy Watch 6 Classic.

item.title: Apple just announced the iPhone 16 and 16 Plus — here's how to pre-order them
item.description: At Apple's Sept. 9 event, the brand debuted its iPhone 16 and 16 Plus. Here's what to know about the new iPhones and when to pre-order them.

item.title: Apple's new AirPods 4 and updated AirPods Max are available for preorder
item.description: Here's where you can pre-order the new AirPods 4 (starting at $129) and updated AirPods Max ($549) ahead of their Sept. 20 release.

item.title: New Apple AirPods are coming, so current models are on sale now
item.description: Ahead of Apple's September 9 event, AirPods are on sale. Find deals on a variety of models including the AirPods 2nd and 3rd generation as well as the AirPods Max.

item.title: Huawei Mate XT: The tri-folding phone that truly turns into a tablet
item.description: Huawei has revealed the Mate XT, a tri-folding phone that turns into a tablet.
